str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From ek and tithemi; to expose; figuratively, to declare.
Pharaoh, the title of ancient Egyptian kings. Of foreign origin; Pharao, an Egyptian king.
Apparently a primary word; a female child, or descendant.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ana and haireomai; to take up, i.e. Adopt; by implication, to take away, i.e. Abolish, murder.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To rear, bring up, nourish, educate. From ana and trepho; to rear.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular

str2: A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
